website_summaries.verdict: A double-win for safety. The weights keep your canopy in place, and the no-pinch design helps prevent fingers from getting caught between the plates.
pros: Includes four 7.5 pounds of weights for 30 pounds total
Covering made from recycled plastic material
No-pinch design makes for easy, safe installation and removal of weights
Fits canopy poles up to 1.25 inches wide
cons: For best security, use two weights with slits on opposing sides

customer_reviews.title: Canopy Weights Prevented My Canopy from Going Airborne!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 sets for my 10 x 10 canopy (7.5 lb + 7.5 lb on each leg) and the weights kept the canopy firmly on the ground during strong wind gusts at a town expo on main street.Some other people were using gallon jugs full of water or sand, but the jugs had to be tied to the canopy upper support structure which greatly decreased their effectiveness. Many vendors had to physically hold on to their canopy so it would not blow away during the wind gusts. Very pleased with performance and the weights are easily transportable with no leaking of the contents. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: James Pietruszka

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 sets
customer_reviews.text: You should order 2 sets if you want to use these on all 4 legs of your canopy. When used alone, my ez up pyramid legs easily slide out of the weights rendering them useless. They are designed to be stacked and work well when you do so.
customer_reviews.author: Nick and Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for use with our Coleman canopies
customer_reviews.text: We live on a lake and frequently get winds over 30mph in the summer. The first year we had our canopies, I simply staked down the legs and anchor cords that came with the Coleman canopy. Then a 50 mph front moved through and simply picked up the canopy and twisted into knots. After replacing the canopy, I bought 8 of these weights and placed them on the windward sides. The next strong front came through and made the canopy shudder like mad, but the weights prevented the canopy from lifting up and pulling out the stakes. No damage.
customer_reviews.author: Hall Of Record

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA - Happy, happy, happy!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly on my 10 X 10 canopy. The instructions say It fits any canopy with legs 1 1/4" or smaller. I read that for more than a light breeze you may want more than 1 set. These weights kind of lock together when stacked so no problem adding more. This 30 LB set was the same price as similar sets that only weigh 20 LBS. Made in the USA! Happy, happy, happy!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: they work, but get at least 2 sets or it's pointless
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these when they were on sale. Glad I have them. I face paint and don't want my canopy flying away and breaking or hurting someone. I use these in addition to 1.5 gal. jugs of water tied to each corner of the canopy. Two of these weights on each leg equals the same weight as the jugs of water. They are cumbersome to carry. I use a leather belt. I think they work well but honestly the jugs do just as good a job.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These worked great on the bases of H Potter outdoor torches. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the canvas bags previously. Had to fill them with something heavy (rocks). Pain in the booty. These weights are so much cleaner, compact, and easy to double stack. People don't trip over them like other items. These are also not super heavy moving one at a time so for those that can't lift, moving these is easily achievable. I have had these a couple of months and they have done their job through a couple of wind/rain storms.
customer_reviews.author: Deederdun

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: I used these just last weekend and they fit the legs of our 10 X 10 canapy tent perfectly. The only thing I would do differently is maybe buy two sets right away. Because of their "U" shape and opening they can slip, or be accedently kicked off the legs. Buying two sets lets you fit them together, eliminating that problem. Then again, that gets expensive. In any event they are a nice addition, to the pins that come with the canopy, to hold things down.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rev

customer_reviews.title: Helps holds down canopy on windy days.
customer_reviews.text: Love these for our large outdoor canopy legs. I bought 8 total so I can interlock each leg especially good on windy days. They are stackable and click into place so they don’t slide on each other. Packing them in the car is each as they plastic is smooth and they stack and don’t shift on the road trips. I try to avoid using the canopy stakes since they come up easily and kids trip on them. But with weights, you could use both stakes and weights on top.
customer_reviews.author: A. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Kept my tent from blowing away
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of these so each of my tent's leg has 2. That did the job. I was at an expo and it got very windy and a lot of other tents were being tossed about in the wind and my tent held up. I love that I don't have to drive stakes except for those events that require staking. I love that I can use these anywhere even indoors. And they fit neatly at the legs. I will highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Dione A. Nancolas

customer_reviews.title: Never got all the weights
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I waited until I needed to use these before I opened the box, so that is on me. I ordered 2 sets of the 30lb weights which should have totaled to 8 - 7.5lb weights. I got 2 7.5lb weights in a box. Severely disappointed as 15lbs was not holding much down. Whomever packed these had no idea what they were doing.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Harris

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 packs of 4 weights for added security and am happy with them so far. We had a huge wind storm recently and luckily I had these bad boys. Chairs were being blown everywhere, but my pop-up 10x10 canopy didn't budge thanks to these weights. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Fillmore

customer_reviews.title: Don’t lock together well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for my canopy hold downs. The problem I find with them is that the plastic material they are made of is, I’m not sure how to say it, but too slippery. When more than one is used the second one stacked on the first slip real easy. There are nipples and dimples to lock them together but they are not deep enough. They need deeper dimples and longer nipples.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I won't be taking Amazons advise again on ordering items that they recommend.
customer_reviews.text: They are what they are advertised to be but I both them for a "Abba Patio 10x13 Feet Fully Enclosed Garden Gazebo Patio Canopy with Mosquito Netting" which Amazon listed as "buy together" and they don't fit. I won't be taking Amazons advise again on ordering items that they recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: per leg) I recommend buying 2 sets in case of stronger winds
customer_reviews.text: Used these weights the first time at a recent craft show. I purchased two sets (two wts.per leg) I recommend buying 2 sets in case of stronger winds. They are so easy to use and have an interlocking feature. They look nice and neat. They worked beautifully. The winds were mild to moderate and they didn't move at all. I am positive they will hold secure in stronger winds. Totally love these and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L.

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I use these on the ground under my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I use these on the ground under my sand bags for my art fair canopy. I was at a fair yesterday and my neighboor's canopy was wobbling around in wind gusts. She has the same sand filled weight bags as mine but my tent was steady. These also keeps the bags off the ground so they soak up less water. Definitely worth the expense and additional weight.
customer_reviews.author: Allison E.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but not practical to hold a tent down
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if these are going to work. In my experience when a wind comes up it "lifts" tents. These will merely go around the legs. I can not see them holding the tent in place. We will see this weekend. and above it asks about "warmth" I don't get that at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Ranada in North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Get 2 of these and you're set
customer_reviews.text: Very handy. Fits great with pretty much any canopy tent. I ordered 2 of these to ensure there's enough weight to keep the tent secure. I wish a strap was included to make it easier to keep them together and carry around... I've seen some other brands include this strap. But instead this comes in a small generic cardboard box, which I continue to use to transport and store them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ruhl

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to weight down the base of my new speaker stands. I had read that someone else had purchased these for the same reason. Well, as weights for the bottom of speaker stands, they work great! My stands are now very sturdy and for that I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Bullitt

customer_reviews.title: These weights out weigh packing sand!!!
customer_reviews.text: Weights hold your tent down for sure! I took them with me to the beach in my beach wagon to hold down our tent. It set up really fast. No need for packing sand. The construction is well made and it has grooves for them to stack together on top of each one. They definitely have very good weight to hold things down on a windy day. No too heavy but too light either. I would highly recommend these weights to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: TopSella

customer_reviews.title: Heavyweights
customer_reviews.text: They are exactly as described but please dont order box of potato chips or crushable objects as Amazon with place in same box. Due to weight i believe a disgruntled delivery man chucked it down my driveway crushing everything else. It survives though as very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: l.Vald

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my E-Z Up Envoy 10x10 Tent
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my E-Z Up Envoy 10x10 Tent. The slots on these weights fit perfectly around the base of the legs and you can stack a second one on top in the opposite orientation to lock them in and put 15 pounds on each corner. However, I'm not sure if you really need 2 sets of these weights, even having just one 7.5 pound weight on each leg was enough of a moderately breezy day. But if you do plan on using your pop up canopy in a really windy day, then 2 sets of these would probably be a good idea. Excellent build quality and works flawlessly, can't really go wrong with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Paje

customer_reviews.title: These Weights Work Well
customer_reviews.text: These weights work well, but I recommend two sets for each easy up. We use them at a winery that I work at and that can experience high winds in the afternoon We very rarely have fly away issues. I bought some for personal use to take camping and people always ask me where I got them because they are doing their job.
customer_reviews.author: AndBeMerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice and portable, stack well.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my popup canopy at craft shows. I had one set that I've used for a few years. I added another set as an extra precaution for windy days. They fit together like Legos, so stay in place when stacked. That also helps when transporting.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Our tent stayed in place just fine!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT find for the added security of weighting down the tent. I use these and stakes last weekend at a windy craft show and everyone was like - where did you find those. Love that you can stack two on top on each other and they interlock. We watched as other people were holding down their tent poles and ours stayed just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny in the Hollow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to keep the tent in place and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Smartest purchase we have made! Perfect way to keep the tent in place and I like the look much better than having to deal with sand bags or milk jugs. We used one set (4 weights) on our 10x10 tent. I think I plan to add another set in the future just for more peace of mind if the wind were to increase while we are tailgating.
customer_reviews.author: Bevwash

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great durable weights. Our family use these weights to hold down our cannopy for car washing and car port (used daily) and have not had any issues. These weights holds down the poles and fit perfectly around the bottom corners. Easy to lay down on the poles and not to wide where it looks like it's bulging. Highly recommended if you're looking for something sleek to hold down cannopies.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Lai Pham

customer_reviews.title: These have held my tent down in some pretty windy conditions
customer_reviews.text: These have held my tent down in some pretty windy conditions. They also fit together nicely. One piece of advice - when putting them on, put them on in different directions (so the insertions each face north/south/east/West).
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to stack, effective and looks nice!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent weights that are durable and hold our 10x10 canopy down really well. You can also stack them for more weight on really windy days. Quick shipping and easy to handle, I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 10 lb weights previously and decided to get the 5 lb ones to ensure that my portable gazebo stays put. They fit together perfectly and I think they should last for quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy enough
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended. Not heavy enough to make a difference holding a 10x10 tent down in even short gusts. Not recommended. Use water jugs of sandbags (40# for $4 at Big Box Stores)
customer_reviews.author: DrBob

customer_reviews.title: Beware this are MASSIVE
customer_reviews.text: These things are massive and very heavy. I thought they would be smaller. I actually only use two because I can’t carry four by myself. Weights work great of course, just beware they are HUGE
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Did what they were suppose to do
customer_reviews.text: I used the weights on our canopy tent and they worked very well. the winds came up at the festival and the tent didn't blow away. they are small enough and fit very well that you don't trip on them.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: Good weight - iffy size weights
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these weights bc they did not fit around the poles as expected. They did seem well made and a good weight otherwise. Be extra careful about your sizing to fit.
customer_reviews.author: CB SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Weighs my tent down.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to weigh down my vendor tent when I do art shows. The came as expected, and they are accurate in weight. The only thing I don't care for is they don't stack nicely, and they are a bit cumbersome to carry. but they are a good price for some extra tent weights, I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maddux

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: These don't lock together well and slide around (or fall off) when a wind begins to move a tent.
customer_reviews.author: Mikejim

customer_reviews.title: Great for canopy tents
customer_reviews.text: These weights are exactly what I need for my tent setup at events. I have a cheap "Garden Treasures" canopy and it stays put with these weights. I've only used them twice and the wind has been about 10-15mph, but my tent has been firmly planted using 6-8 weights. I probably would be fine with 4 but it only takes one experieince with the tent blowing around to make the extra set worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Wood

customer_reviews.title: You need these.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, why pay for weights, because these are amazing thats why. We have people enjoying parties, wind and storms here but these keep our canopy in place without taking out our guests at the ankles. A must for more civilized gathers.
customer_reviews.author: James S

customer_reviews.title: Best weights ever
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent. My only wish is that the stacking notches were a bit deeper on them. I have an ABCCanopy 10x10 tent. These lovely weights, two sets for 60 lbs total, kept my tent securely on the ground through two days of craft fairs in 15-20 mph winds with 25-30 mph gusts. They were better than anything else I saw other people using.
customer_reviews.author: Nikkifam

customer_reviews.title: Good weight, bad design
customer_reviews.text: So the problem with these is simple, the plastic is slick and the canopy legs slide right out in the wind. This requires two on each leg slid on from different directions, a simple velcro closure would solve the problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These weights have it ALL OVER weighted sand bags.
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to holding down my canopy in high winds, these interlinked by weights work 1000% better then those sand bag weights. No bags to have to fill; no sand bags to tear. No zippers or seams to malfunction. weather-proof. What's not to like about them. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R

customer_reviews.title: Weights secure your Tent safely and quickly
customer_reviews.text: I used these weights two sets to secure a Caddiss Rapid Shelter and with weights the tent was secure in gusts of 50 mph winds in the Mountains of Pennsylvania. I would highly recommend these weights as added safety to secure your tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and hate putting stakes in the ground
customer_reviews.text: I frequently exhibit at craft fairs, and hate putting stakes in the ground....leaves a mess in my car, and I usually can't find a hammer. These are perfect to keep the tent in place, able to be wiped down if they get dirty, and travel with ease. I only bought the 4, and it holds my EZ UP tent without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: hermomtoo

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I am the Campus Pastor of a church in North Carolina and had a problem with the wind blowing over our flag out front advertising for the church. I bought these and they work perfectly. They keep the flag secured and don't stick out like a sore thumb like a sandbag would. I'm sure they work great for most anything involving a pole.
customer_reviews.author: Deeds777

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy enough
customer_reviews.text: Weights are nowhere close to be enough to hold any gazibo in place during windy days. You would need at least 4 in each corner.
customer_reviews.author: Petra

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two sets of the 7.5lb weights for my 10x10 canopy tent. Though I wasn't sure I needed that much weight, I'm definitely glad I had it. I used the tent along and weights on the beach this past weekend. The wind was blowing a constant 15-20mph with gusts around 30 mph. The tent did not move. I also use these weights while tailgating on paved asphalt. No problems at all and I'm glad I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Wages

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny -- Provides Peace of Mind When the Wind Kicks UP!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to weigh down free-standing display easels at outdoor events. Worth the money when the wind picks up and you would otherwise worry about parts of your exhibit blowing away. I invested in three boxes and I congratulate myself for my foresight!! Slide them down over the cross beam and around each of the legs of the easel. (NOTE: The weights are intended for SQUARE canopy poles so don't expect them to fit perfectly for easel legs; adapt!
customer_reviews.author: bleu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. When everyone else at my tailgate was having issues with their easy-up min stayed perfectly stable. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Manly Stuwart

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy weights
customer_reviews.text: These heavier weights worked well to hold down the shade tent covering my car on my driveway. But suggest you get at least 2 sets as 15 lbs. is probably the minimum amount you'll need if windy. If you have multiple weights, they interlock on each other and are quick to pull on/off around the tent pole. Wish they came in 10 lbs. each, but the 7.5 lbs. each weights are better than the lighter 5 lb. weights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comes with 4 weights, Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: I like that this comes with four weights for different uses. Solid, sealed heavy duty plastic weights made in the USA. Although I'm returning the canopy umbrella, I am keeping these weights, four in a box, due to their multi-purpose uses around the home, in the yard, tailgating or camping.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: This was as we expected. They are heavy to ...
customer_reviews.text: This was as we expected. They are heavy to carry around, so that part is not ideal. We had to set up our tent in a parking lot. It was a windy day, so we used the weights. The wind was still too much, so we took the tent down.
customer_reviews.author: L.Moc

customer_reviews.title: Nice weights to hold a shade in place
customer_reviews.text: The weights conveniently stacked together for holding an easy up or shade in place easily product is easy to assemble gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: David M Stotler

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea ! No need for sand or jugs of water. This product is so good I bought another set
customer_reviews.author: DAC

customer_reviews.title: Best Product of this Type
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this product twice and will probably buy more in the future. Store them in a 5 Gallon bucket and take them when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Monopoly J

customer_reviews.title: Not effective in winds over about 5 miles an hour
customer_reviews.text: They are nice but don't stay on the legs very well if it is windy out. Great idea but not strong enough, would not waste money on this size but go up to higher weight and it might work better. I used them on a semi windy day and they didn't help much.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It makes my tent to stay for windy day. Easy to put it on, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: FuNiu

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Used one set on our canopy at a football game this week end. Worked perfectly. Only a light breeze but it didn't move. Will update with future uses.Also note these are heavier than most of the other weights available.Would buy again and recommend. Update- Yes, get 2 sets if you live in a high wind area like I do- but still great!!
customer_reviews.author: fwd62

customer_reviews.title: We had our large 10 x 10 canopy up all weekend on our driveway for a garage sale and it did fantastic despite going through a pr
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of these weights, so I had 2 weights on each leg, giving me 15 pounds of support on each leg. We had our large 10 x 10 canopy up all weekend on our driveway for a garage sale and it did fantastic despite going through a pretty rough overnight thunderstorm! The canopy did not budge from its spot. I love these weights and highly recommend them! I also recommend buying 2 sets in order to provide plenty of weight support in the event of bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: IndyGal65

customer_reviews.title: No more tripping over tie down ropes!
customer_reviews.text: ordered for a canopy I didn't even know they made these. They interlock. We now have 3 sets of them because the canopy resides in a very windy location. they are great and much better than having the tie downs where you trip over!!. highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Recommend 2 sets.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets for my 10x10 canopy to use at my campsite. Use 2 on each leg. They interlock to stack nicely and if you rotate the top weight 180 degrees from the bottom, the foot of the canopy is locked in. It holds the canopy very firmly and it would take a real gale level wind to move it. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Well these are perfect for any elements and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My family and I go on several camping trips through out the seasons. We have always had a hard time driving our stakes in the ground, hitting rocks and so forth. Well these are perfect for any elements and so easy to use. It will only take seconds to secure your pop up. Even in high winds and rain they still stood up to the weather. These are a must have for any camper.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Forget

customer_reviews.title: just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: haven't had to use them yet but know it's what I wanted for those times when I can't put stakes in the ground for my canopy.
customer_reviews.author: chesneyskr73

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Be sure canopy legs are not more than 1 1/4" or will not fit had to send back
customer_reviews.author: P.d

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to hold down my pop up. It works as described.
customer_reviews.author: E in SF

customer_reviews.title: I love the canopy weights!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I love the canopy weights! I have a EZ Pop Up Pyramid Tent that I use for Street Fairs and Flea Markets. The weights are a much better solution than sand bags which can be messy trying to fill and awkward to store or stakes which you can't use on concrete or cement. You can use them on any surface and it makes the tent stable in rainy and windy conditions. I had both! They fit perfectly, nice and neat on the frame and are not an eye sore. I rarely leave reviews but this was one of my best investments for my vending.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R. Pegues

customer_reviews.title: These provide the safety and look great too. They fit nicely on the supports of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are outstanding and so professional looking. OBTW, we use them to stabilize our photolight stands. We had been using sandbags which provided safety. These provide the safety and look great too. They fit nicely on the supports of the light and backdrop stands.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: but we went with one and it handled pretty moderate winds with no problem
customer_reviews.text: These canopy weights were absolutely what we needed during our outdoor vendor events. I've heard some claim that you should buy two sets, but we went with one and it handled pretty moderate winds with no problem. They are also very unobtrusive and look much more professional than cinder blocks or some makeshift MacGyver contraption. Overall we are pleased, and you will be too.
customer_reviews.author: Melina Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Kept the tent from blowing up and away.
customer_reviews.text: These were great for the tent we had for the party. Without them, the tent would have definately blown away that windy day.
customer_reviews.author: Janet McCarthy Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Works Well in Moderate Winds
customer_reviews.text: Cutout was perfect size for several different brands of canopies. Even in moderately breezy conditions, these keep the canopy right in place. I used these at a recent school event. I also used the set of 4 - 5 lb weights and both worked well but I tend to be one of those people that over kills when it comes to these things and so my personal preference is for the 7.5 lb weights, especially if the price is comparable.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: These work great on the tents at ball tournaments
customer_reviews.text: A must have!! These work great on the tents at ball tournaments!!
customer_reviews.author: teamcam

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for weighing down our shade canopy - we bought 2 sets. They worked great at the beach, and we even use them at home in our rocky backyard. They store nicely and are easy to transport - no clumsy sandbags.
customer_reviews.author: Sunkist

customer_reviews.title: Great, but get a few sets
customer_reviews.text: Work wonders, but I think you'll need to buy a few sets to really have enough weight. Plus the additional sets sit on the lower sets in any orientation thus "locking" the leg between the weights. I just used this for a week at deer camp, 2 sets, with moderate winds at times and I had no concerns that my canopy would take to the skies.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel H.

customer_reviews.title: The truth!
customer_reviews.text: Due to my laziness I left the tent frame and weighs as is from last summer until this summer. These weights held the tent frame DOWN!! It held it down surviving 3 bad wind storms that torn down trees!!
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Coye

customer_reviews.title: We were very pleased with the quality of these weights for the price ...
customer_reviews.text: We were very pleased with the quality of these weights for the price and they actually were heavier per weight (7.5 versus 5 lb) than some that we priced at a local sporting good store for the same price! We live in an area that can sometimes have strong winds and these weights have done their job!
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Anne-Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good value for heavy shade tent weights
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They are heavier than the Quick Shade brand and they have little notches and holes so if you stack more than one on the same tent leg they stay together. I like that they aren't full of sand so they don't make a mess everywhere. They are nice for setting up a shade tent on a parking lot or street where you can't use stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: These are great little weights
customer_reviews.text: These are great little weights ! Plastic coated so they do not scratch anything. The slot looks like the right size for any pop-up shelter. However I am currently using them to hold down an artificial Christmas tree that lights up out deck, they work great for that use !
customer_reviews.author: cybershopper

customer_reviews.title: Used them recently at a street fair art show. ...
customer_reviews.text: Used them recently at a street fair art show. Was not windy so I can't comment on how they would have performed, but they kept my tent secure and safe.
customer_reviews.author: denise jenious

customer_reviews.title: Nice add on to my canopy
customer_reviews.text: Nice add on to my canopy. Purchased 2 sets to double up on weighing down the posts. A must have for any canopy owner.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 sets of these last year and now I'm ordering another set. They interlock on top of each other which keeps them from slipping apart. I use them for my canopy and also to keep our chairs in place when we are not using them.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These weights work great and this is the 2nd set ordered!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Boopadoop

customer_reviews.title: Holds my tent for hefty wind gusts
customer_reviews.text: As a vendor at our local famers market, I was sent running to Amazon after my whole tent flew over my truck to the ground behind me when a gust of wind caught it! Sort of embarrassing! Now, I can watch as the other vendors have to stand and hold their tents up by hand during wind gusts while I sit back and relax with these weights securely in place.
customer_reviews.author: Beulah

customer_reviews.title: LOve it.!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy! Probably will buy one more set . :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well these worked
customer_reviews.text: Surprised this worked in our crazy windy backyard on a hill, in the Bay Area!! Held down a Coleman pop up canopy with 4 weights per leg. No issues even though I fully expected they wouldn't worked. Happy to be proven wrong!! ;-) Canopy is alive for another season.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the sandbag
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the sandbag. They are cleaner, easier store and carry. People ask me all the time where I get these. I bought two sets and it has held my tent very well during high winds. Would suggest buying two packs for optimal support.
customer_reviews.author: RhubarbWire

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product, as described. A lot easier and more convenient to use than other weight methods
customer_reviews.author: travelsje

customer_reviews.title: Love that they are compact and sip right onto the ...
customer_reviews.text: They worked but we may purchase a second set. Our tent moved during a summer rain storm. It didn't move much, but with expensive inventory inside the tent we don't want it to move at all. Love that they are compact and sip right onto the tent leg. A second facing the other direction might do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Joy M. Bidlack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! We get windy days in Texas and these definitely came in handy on one of them. It held the canopy down perfectly! People who had just staked their canopy in ground had problems with one or two sides coming up when a gust came, but not me! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Recommend stakes instead.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, but heavy to carry around. Stakes work much better and don't take up space or weigh much.
customer_reviews.author: maryleam

customer_reviews.title: 7.5 lbs vs 10 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Like the product. Wanted the 10 lbs each but settled for the 7.5 lbs. Probably should have gotten waited for the 10 lbs. I will order the 10 lbs one to add more weight to the canopy legs. Love the design.
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The weights work very well. They help keep our canopy down in wind. The 7 pound weight is just right. Friends of ours who have lighter weights have more movement than we do. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hook

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy enough.
customer_reviews.text: By themselves, there are not heavy enough. You could buy two packs and stack them, but you're not going to get much out of a single 4 pack of these.
customer_reviews.author: WilsonWilsonJr

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: You would need a ton of these to really keep a pop-up tent in place, they're not very heavy individually. The plastic is also quite slippery, so they are hard to keep in place. I would recommend getting some cement landscape blocks at a home improvement store over these, honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Smith

customer_reviews.title: buy 2 sets
customer_reviews.text: Not heavy enough. They work great in pairs. Putting just one on a leg and it just slides off or gets lifted. 2 for each leg is a must. It locks the leg into place. Buy 2 sets.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Better than sandbags
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the sandbags and easier to move and stack. More professional looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Scrap Forever

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it claims at a better price than the alternatives
customer_reviews.text: well constructed solid weights. Each weight is 7.5 lbs (versus 5 lb/weight for its competitors). I bought 3 sets totaling 90 lbs. Weights interlock so that the can be stacked in alternate directions so that they don't move once attached. Much less mess than having to deal with sand bags. I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AlexO

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the heavier ones of the two options as we live in a pretty windy area and the cover it will be used on will be under stress. These seem well made and sturdy. Much needed if you have a portable cover. I will use at horse shows and will be much easier than trying to drive puny stakes into the hard ground!
customer_reviews.author: KC Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good product but check your tent legs...
customer_reviews.text: Great weights and much easier than sand bags. Unfortunately, the weights are for a standard tent and won't fit the pentagonal legs on my tent.
customer_reviews.author: Vjhawkins602417

customer_reviews.title: Buy these weights!
customer_reviews.text: They work great!! I opted for 2 sets to have 15lbs per leg on my tent. It was tested right away after our setup was complete with a nice gust of wind. The tent didn't move. it stayed firm during a 12 hour event with multiple small wind gust.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hall

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This are great. We have had windy weather recently and I know they prevented our gazebo from blowing away.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen L

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold canopy down.
customer_reviews.text: My canopys still blew away even with 2 on each leg turned opposite so the legs were locked in. They need to truly connect somehow. Maybe a chain through the peg hole.
customer_reviews.author: pinkpuppylover

product_meta.title: US Weight Tailgater Canopy Weights with No-Pinch Design for Easy, Safe, Installation and Removal to Secure Tents, Canopies and Umbrellas at Outdoor Events
feature_bullets: Secure tents, canopies, and umbrellas at outdoor events with these interlocking weights
Includes four 7.5 lb. weights for 30 lbs. total weight – more weight than most others in the marketplace
Made in the United States from recycled plastic material and filled with cement
No-pinch design makes for easy, safe installation and removal of weights
Interlocking weights securely fit all canopy poles up to 1 ¼” wide (does not include carry strap)
